revised_title: Contrasting Experiments on Ignited Substances: A Response to Buffon's Findings
tldr: John Whitehurst conducts experiments on heated metals and challenges Buffon's findings that heated substances become more massive. Whitehurst's experiments show that metals may become lighter when heated due to the ascent of rarefied air and the expansion of the metal. He also speculates that Buffon's experiment might have been affected by differences in the expansion of the iron mass and the beam it was hung on.
